hed:
The World through the
Eyes of the US
dek: The countries that have preoccupied Americans since 1900.

prelude.value: Before social media, before nightly TV news, before radio, there was the newspaper. This drove (and to a large extent still drives) daily conversations about what was going down in the world. And the front page was where the most important stuff went. Thanks to the New York Times archive, much of that content is still preserved. I looked at 724,513 front page headlines since 1900 to find out what countries around world dominated our attention month after month, year after year.
